    Overview of pathway network databases

    Kim Jablonski, Martin Pirkl

    2021-01-19

    pathway_databases.Rmd

    Introduction

    Load required packages

    Load the package with the library function.

    library(tidyverse)

library(dce)

set.seed(42)
    # only use 'small' databases in this example
df_info <- get_pathway_info(database_list = c("kegg", "biocarta", "nci", "panther", 
    "pharmgkb"), include_network_statistics = TRUE)
    ## Processing kegg
## Processing biocarta
## Processing nci
## Processing panther
## Processing pharmgkb
    df_info %>% head %>% knitr::kable()
    database id name node_num edge_num
    kegg hsa:00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis 67 67
    kegg hsa:00020 Citrate cycle (TCA cycle) 30 30
    kegg hsa:00030 Pentose phosphate pathway 29 29
    kegg hsa:00040 Pentose and glucuronate interconversions 33 33
    kegg hsa:00051 Fructose and mannose metabolism 32 32
    kegg hsa:00052 Galactose metabolism 28 28

    Pathway database overview

    We provide access to the following topological pathway databases using graphite (Sales et al. 2012):

    df_info %>% count(database) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% knitr::kable()
    database n
    kegg 317
    biocarta 247
    nci 212
    panther 94
    pharmgkb 66 
    df_info %>% ggplot(aes(x = node_num)) + geom_histogram() + facet_wrap(~database, 
    scales = "free") + theme_minimal()
